SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Finance Limited has informed the Exchange regarding Intimation of Committee meetings for raising funds : In furtherance to our letter dated July 26, 2024 regarding outcome of Board Meeting, we hereby inform you that pursuant to regulation 29(2), regulation 50 and any other applicable provisions of Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements), Regulations 2015, the Company will consider raising of funds by way of issue of redeemable non-convertible debt securities including bonds in onshore/offshore market on private placement basis, subject to market conditions and in this regard, the meeting(s) of the concerned committees viz. the Banking and Finance Committee and Allotment Committee- NCDs will be held to consider and approve the issue and allotment of redeemable non-convertible debt securities / bonds during the period from August 1, 2024 to October 31, 2024 as per their respective terms of reference, subject to such terms and conditions including the issue price of debt securities/ bonds, as the said committees may deem fit.'.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Finance Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Intimation of Committee meetings for raising fundsIn furtherance to our letter dated April 26, 2024 regarding outcome of Board Meeting, we hereby inform you that pursuant to regulation 29(2), regulation 50 and any other applicable provisions of Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements), Regulations 2015, the Company will consider raising of funds by way of issue of redeemable non-convertible debt securities including bonds in onshore/offshore market on private placement basis, subject to market conditions and in this regard, the meeting(s) of the concerned committees viz. the Banking and Finance Committee and Allotment Committee- NCDs will be held to consider and approve the issue and allotment of redeemable non-convertible debt securities / bonds during the period from May 1, 2024 to July 31, 2024 as per their respective terms of reference, subject to such terms and conditions including the issue price of debt securities/ bonds, as the said committees may deem fit.'.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Finance Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'In furtherance to our letter dated October 26, 2023 regarding outcome of Board Meeting and intimation of Committee meeting dated October 26, 2023 for raising Funds through issue of debt securities for the period from November 01, 2023 to January 31, 2024, we write to inform you that the Allotment Committee - NCDs of the Company in its meeting held today, approved and allotted senior, secured, rated, listed, redeemable, taxable non-convertible debentures (NCD) on Private placement as per the details given in Annexure A.Kindly take the above information on record.'.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Finance Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Sub.: Intimation of Committee meetings for raising fundsIn furtherance to our letters dated October 26, 2023 regarding outcome of Board Meeting, we hereby inform you that pursuant to regulation 29(2), regulation 50 and any other applicable provisions of Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements), Regulations 2015, the Company will consider raising of funds by way of issue of redeemable non-convertible debt securities including bonds in onshore/offshore market on private placement basis, subject to market conditions and in this regard, the meeting(s) of the concerned committees viz. the Banking and Finance Committee, Debt Issuance Committee and Allotment Committee- NCDs will be held to consider and approve the issue and allotment of redeemable non-convertible debt securities / bonds during the period from November 1, 2023 to January 31, 2024 as per their respective terms of reference, subject to such terms and conditions including the issue price of debt securities/ bonds, as the said committees may deem fit.'.

SUBJECT: Credit Rating
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange  that in compliance with the circular SEBI/HO/MIRSD/MIRSD_CRADT/P/CIR/2021/594 issued by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (���SEBI���) on July 16, 2021 and the subsequent circular SEBI/HO/MIRSD/MIRSD_CRADT /P/CIR/2022/43 of April 1, 2022, for standardising the rating scales used by the credit rating agencies, ICRA has discontinued the medium-term rating scale used for assigning ratings to the fixed deposit programmes of entities. Accordingly, ICRA Ratings has migrated the rating currently outstanding for the fixed deposits programme of STFC from the medium-term rating scale to the long-term rating scale. The migration of the rating has resulted in a change in the rating symbol as per the attachment.

SUBJECT: Monitoring Agency Report
DETAILS: The Company made Rights Issue of equity shares through Letter of Offer dated July 07, 2020. The RightsIssue opened on July 16, 2020 and closed on July 30, 2020. On August 06, 2020, the Company allotted2,61,78,777 Rights equity shares at an issue price of Rs.570 per Rights Equity Share (including apremium of Rs.560 per Rights Equity Share) aggregating to Rs.1492.19 crores and the said Right equityshares were listed on stock exchanges on August 7, 2020.In compliance with the provisions of Regulation 32(6) of the Securities and Exchange Board of India(Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 read with Regulation 82(4) of theSecurities and Exchange Board of India (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations,2018, we are enclosing herewith the Monitoring Agency Report for the quarter ended September 30,2020, issued by ICICI Bank Limited, the Monitoring Agency appointed to monitor the utilisation ofproceeds of the Rights Issue of the Company.The entire proceeds raised by the Company through the Rights Issue, during the quarter endedSeptember 30, 2020, have been utilised for the objects as stated in the Letter of Offer dated July07, 2020 of the Rights Issue.

SUBJECT: Committee Meeting Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange regarding Outcome of Committee Meeting held on July 12, 2018. In furtherance to our letter dated June 29, 2018 regarding intimation of Debt Issuance Committee Meeting for raising Funds, we wish to inform you that the Debt Issuance Committee of the Company in its meeting held today i.e. 12th July,2018 passed the resolution to approve the allotment of 3,64,85,186 secured redeemable non-convertible debentures of face value of Rs. 1,000 each (NCDs) with regard to the  Public Issue of NCDs with a Base Issue Size of Rs.1,00,000 lakhs with an option to retain oversubscription upto Rs.4,00,000 lakhs aggregating upto Rs.5,00,000 lakhs (��Shelf Limit��), (��Tranche- I Issue��). The meeting commenced at 7.45 p.m. and concluded at 8.15 p.m. The said NCDs shall be listed on the BSE Limited and National Stock Exchange of India Limited.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Disclosure under Regulation 30 '.In furtherance to our letter dated January 24, 2018 on the captioned subject, we wish to inform you that Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited (STFC) has transferred 16630435 Equity Shares of Shriram Automall India Limited (SAMIL) of face value of Rs.10 each fully paid up to MXC Solutions India Private Limited (MXC) at Rs.94.03 per share aggregating to Rs.15637 Lakhs. As such, MXC has become majority shareholder of SAMIL. As per the Shareholders�� Agreement, the Board of Directors of SAMIL in its meeting held today appointed directors nominated by MXC on the Board of Directors of SAMIL which constitutes majority directors of MXC on the Board of Directors of SAMIL. Consequently, SAMIL has ceased to be a subsidiary of STFC from today.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Newspaper Advertisement of Postal Ballot Notice'.  In continuation to our letter dated November 10, 2017, with regard to the Postal Ballot Notice, please find enclosed copies of the advertisement published today in Business Standard and Makkal Kural daily newspapers.The advertisements will also be made available on the Company��s website at www.stfc.in.This is for your information and records.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Postal Ballot Notice '. In furtherance to our letter dated November 01, 2017, please find enclosed Postal Ballot Notice dated November 01, 2017 along with a Postal Ballot Form contained in the Self-addressed Business Reply Inland Letter Card (BRILC) seeking approval from the Members of the Company for amending Articles of Association of the Company by insertion of Article 32A to carry out consolidation and re-issuance of non-convertible debt securities in accordance with Regulation 20A of the SEBI (Issue and Listing of Debt Securities) Regulations, 2008.The Postal Ballot Notice and Postal Ballot Form contained in the Self-addressed BRILC is being sent to the Members whose names appear in the Register of Members/ Record of Depositories as on the cut-off date being Monday, November 06, 2017.In compliance with Regulation 44 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 and provisions of the Section 110 of the Act read with the Rules, the Company is pleased to offer e-voting facility to all the Members. The Company has engaged the Central Depository Services (India) Limited (CDSL) for facilitating e-voting in a secure manner.The voting period will commence on Monday, November 13, 2017 (9:00 Hours IST) and will end on Tuesday, December 12, 2017 (17:00 Hours IST). The results of the Postal Ballot will be declared on Wednesday, December 13, 2017 at the Registered office of the Company.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Disqualification of Director under section 164(2) of the Companies Act, 2013This has reference to letter no. NSE/LIST/20663 dated September 27, 2017 received from National Stock Exchange of India Limited on the captioned subject. The said letter was circulated to all the directors of the Company and also considered at the Board Meeting held today.A director on the Board of Directors of the Company whose name is included in the list of disqualified directors under Section 164(2) of the Companies Act, 2013 posted on the website of Ministry of Corporate Affairs (��MCA��) has made a representation in the prescribed Form to MCA on October 10, 2017 for removal of his disqualification. On October 12, 2017, he filed a petition in this regard in the Hon��ble High Court of Gujarat at Ahmedabad. On October 13, 2017, the Hon��ble High Court granted an Ad-interim relief/stay sought in the Petition filed by the Director. The Notice issued by the Hon��ble High Court to the Respondents is returnable on 30.11.2017. As such, the director is permitted to continue his directorship. The Company will keep the Stock Exchanges informed under applicable Regulations of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, if required.  '.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Confidentiality, Exclusivity and Standstill Agreement with IDFC Group'. This has reference to our letter dated July 08, 2017 informing about the approval accorded by the Board of Directors in its meeting held on July 08, 2017 for entering into a Confidentiality, Exclusivity and Standstill Agreement (CES Agreement) to evaluate a potential combination of certain businesses and subsidiaries/affiliates/associate companies of the Shriram Group engaged in the credit and non-credit financial services sector with the IDFC Group. This Proposed potential combination was subject to regulatory approvals and other various processes including due diligence . The CES Agreement was drawn up for a period of 90 days from 8th July 2017.Vide our letter dated October 05, 2017 we have informed you that the discussions between the Shriram Group and IDFC Group regarding the potential combination and the Due Diligence exercise are continuing and the parties have agreed to extend the exclusivity period of the CES Agreement up to 8th November 2017. Despite best efforts by both Shriram and IDFC, we could not hit common ground and arrive at a mutually acceptable Structure and Valuation. Further, both Parties have agreed for aborting any further discussions on the Proposed potential combination. Consequently the ��Confidentiality, Exclusivity and Standstill Agreement�� entered between both the Groups stands terminated with immediate effect. We request you to treat this intimation as compliance with the applicable provisions of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.

The response from the company is awaited.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange that In furtherance to Company's letter dated February 09, 2017 and letter dated February 10, 2017, Company hereby inform the Exchange that the Company has issued on February 15, 2017, the Senior Secured Notes due 2020 payable in U.S. Dollars with coupon of 8.25% p.a. amounting to Rs. 7,000,000,000 (the Rupee Denominated Bonds ) to Credit Suisse AG, Singapore Branch, International Finance Corporation and Deutsche Bank AG, Singapore Branch.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange that the meeting of the Debt Issuance Committee was held on February 10, 2017 and approved further issue of Senior Secured Notes due 2020 payable in U.S. Dollars with a coupon of 8.25% p.a. amounting to Rs. 2,000,000,000 to Deutsche Bank AG, Singapore Branch , Initial Purchaser (the 'Rupee Denominated Bonds') to be consolidated and form a single series with the Rs. 4,750,000,000 8.25 per cent Senior Secured Notes due 2020 Payable in U.S. Dollars issued on 18 January 2017 and Rs. 1,750,000,000 8.25 percent. Senior Secured Notes due 2020 Payable in U.S. Dollars issued on January 20, 2017 (the 'Existing Notes'). With respect to the Existing Notes, the Company had sent various intimations and filed disclosures with Stock Exchanges between January 12, 2017 and January 20, 20 17. In this connection the Company has signed on February 10, 2017 a Purchase Agreement with the Deutsche Bank AG, Singapore Branch , for purchase of Rupee Denominated Bonds The Rupee Denominated Bonds will be issued and allotted to the investors outside India. The Rupee Denominated Bonds will be listed on the Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited (the 'SGX-ST'). The proceeds of Rupee Denominated Bonds will be utilized in accordance with the guidelines issued by the Reserve Bank of lndia.

SUBJECT: Reply to Clarification Sought
DETAILS: The Exchange has sought clarification from Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited with respect to announcement dated 25-Oct-2016, regarding "Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange regarding Outcome of Board Meeting held on October 25, 2016.".On basis of above the Company is required to clarify following:1. Whether proposed to be listed? If yes, name of the stock exchange(s);2. Tenure of the instrument - date of allotment and date of maturity;3. Coupon/interest offered, schedule of payment of coupon/interest and principal;4. Charge/security, if any, created over the assets;5. Special right/interest/privileges attached to the instrument and changes thereof;The Company has clarified : that We have taken approval from the Board of Directors for issue of Non-Convertible Debentures on private placement basis up to Rs.7000 crores. The NCDs are yet to be issued. Hence, this details can not be furnished at this juncture.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange that the subscription list for the Tranche-I Issue opened on July 02, 2014 in terms of the Tranche-I Prospectus dated June 24, 2014 (the "Tranche-I Prospectus"). The Company has received full subscription of the Base Issue Size of Rs. 50,000 lacs. Accordingly, in terms of the Tranche-I Prospectus, the duly authorized Committee of the Directors of the Company in its meeting held on July 03, 2014 has passed a resolution approving the early closure of the Tranche-I Issue on Friday, July 04, 2014.     The Company will issue a public notice in accordance with the provisions of the Shelf Prospectus and Tranche-I Prospectus dated June 24, 2014, through an advertisement (Copy of Creative of the advertisement is enclosed) in the leading national daily newspapers on July 04, 2014 in connection with such early closure of the Tranche-I Issue.     Accordingly, July 04, 2014 shall be the last day for inviting subscriptions in relation to the Tranche-I Issue and the Tranche-I Issue will close on Friday, July 04, 2014.    The Company will file a copy of the public notice for early closure of the Tranche-I Issue on July 4, 2014.

Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated,"We wish to confirm that we are not aware of the reasons for the current increase in volume of the Equity shares of the Company on the stock exchanges. SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on December 21, 2011, has approved the Scheme of Arrangement ("Scheme") for amalgamation of Shriram Holdings (Madras) Private Limited ("SHMPL") with the Company, subject to the approval of the Hon'ble Madras High Court, and consents and sanctions of other regulatory authorities, shareholders, bankers, creditors and such other parties as may be necessary. On the basis of the Valuation Report issued by Grant Thornton and Fairness Opinion issued by Kotak Mahindra Capital Company Limited, the Board has granted its approval to the share swap ratio of 313:124 i.e. 313 equity shares of Rupees 10 (ten) each fully paid of the Company to be issued for every 124 equity shares of Rupees 10 (ten) each fully paid up of SHMPL, pursuant to the Scheme. Pursuant to the Scheme, SHMPL's existing investment (i.e. 9,33,71,512 equity shares) in the Company would be cancelled, and based on the share swap approved, 9,38,72,380 equity shares of the Company would be issued to the shareholders of SHMPL. This would imply additional equity issuance of 5,00,868 equity shares (approximately 0.22% of post issue capital) by the Company, in consideration for additional net assets of SHMPL.

SUBJECT: Subsidiary
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that:"We are in the process of incorporating a fully owned subsidiary by name Shriram Automall India Limited, which will have its registered office at Chennai, Tamil Nadu. Shriram Automall will be engaged in the business of creating infrastructure for facilitating trading in pre-owned commercial vehicles. Shriram Automall will set up Auto Malls in different parts of the country, refurbish and sell pre-owned commercial vehicles under the name "New Look", provide web-based computerized touch screen kiosks in all our branches across the country under the name 'One Stop', and will also provide a host of other business services to the trucking community in the country under one roof. The subsidiary will be earning fee income for these services tendered".

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has acquired the assets of GE Transportation Financial Services.. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has vide its letter inter-alia stated,"In the course of our regular business operations, we have purchased hypothecation loan outstandings of commercial vehicles and construction equipments of GE Capital Services India and GE Capital Financial Services (GE) aggregating to approximately Rs.1100 crores. Being a Non Banking Fiancial Company engaged in financing of Commercial Vehicles and Construction Equipments, our business involves borrowing  from different sources including loans from Banks/Financial Institutions, Placement/issue of debentures, issue of Commercial Papers etc. and deployment of the same by way of hypothecation loans to Commercial Vehicles and Construction Equipments Owners. Further, the total assets under management of our company as of September 30,2009 were Rs.25,824 Crores."

SUBJECT: Conversion of Warrants
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange vide its letter dated June 12, 2009 that "Shriram Holdings (Madras) Private Ltd (SHMPL) was allotted 80,00,000 warrants, each convertible into one-equity shares of Rs. 10/- each by way of preferential allotment at warrant price of Rs.300/- per warrant. At the time of allotment, sum of Rs.30/- per warrant was paid by the allottee as the subscription amount for the warrants, which is to be adjusted against the warrant exercise price at the time of exercise of their option for conversion. SHMPL has since opted for conversion of these warrants and has paid the exercise price of Rs.270/- per warrant on these 80,00,000 warrants. At the meeting of the Allotment Committee of Board of Directors held today, as per the terms of issue of the said warrants, the Company has converted 80,00,000 warrants held by SHMPL into 80,00,000 equity shares of Rs.10/- each and allotted these shares to SHMPL. These shares shall rank pari passu with existing equity shares of the company".

SUBJECT: Reg.7(3) of SEBI (Substantial Acq of shares &Takeovers),1997
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has submitted to the Exchange a copy of the disclosure pursuant to regulation 7(3) of the SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares & Take Over) Regulations, 1997. As stated therein, it may be noted that there is no direct holding by the transferee and the transferor in the Target Company and the acquisition is an indirect acquisition in the Target Company. The Company has further informed the Exchange that: There is no direct acquisition of shares of the Target Company by the Acquirer. There is no direct holding by the transferor and the transferee in the Target Company. However, 95,63,715 Equity Shares aggregating to 99.88% held by Shriram Motor Finance (Partnership Firm) in Shriram Capital Limited (formerly known as Shriram Financial Services Holdings Limited) has been acquired by Shriram Ownership Trust on 25.3.2008. Shriram Capital Limited holds 1,56,90,419 Equity Shares aggregating 50% in Shriram Holdings (Madras) Private Limited. Shriram Holdings (Madras) Private Limited in turn holds 8,53,71,512 Equity Shares aggregating 42.03% in the Equity Capital of the Target Company. Hence, the transaction is an indirect acquisition in the Target Company. There is no direct holding by the transferee and the transferor in the Target Company and the current acquisition is an indirect acquisition in the Target Company. The acquisition falls under interse transfer amongst group as specified under Regulation 3(1)(e)(i) of The Securities And Exchange Board of India (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 1997. A copy of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here.

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that: "Intimation be and is hereby given that 9th February 2007 to be considered as the Record Date for the purpose of Payment of Dividend and for the Allotment of shares to the Shareholders of Shriram Overseas Finance Limited (SOFL), consequent to its merger with the Company vide High Court Order dated 1st December 2006 of the High Court of Judicature at Madras, w.e.f. 1st April 2005 as the Appointed Date of Merger. Therefore, kindly note that - 1) As per the sanctioned scheme of Amalgamation, as referred above, the SOFL shareholders are eligible for the Dividend declared during the year 2005-06 and any dividend declared thereafter, as the appointed date of merger being 1st April 2005; 2) Accordingly, SOFL shareholders are eligible for following dividends, the provisions for the same have already been made by the Company,: a) Date of Declaration - 30th November 2005, % of Dividend - 10% Equity Dividend; b) Date of Declaration - 28th June 2006, % of Dividend - 20% Equity Dividend; c) Date of Declaration - 29th November 2006, % of Dividend - 10% Equity Dividend. 3) Consequent to the said Amalgamation as sanctioned by the High Court, shares of the Company are to be allotted to SOFL shareholders in the share exchange ratio of three equity shares of the Company as fully paid-up for every five equity shares, fully paid-up, held in the share capital of SOFL".

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that "the Scheme of Amalgamation of Shriram Overseas Finance Limited (SOFL) (transferor Company) with this Company (transferee Company), has been sanctioned and the Order thereof has been pronounced by the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Madras on 1st December, 2006. The Scheme of Amalgamation has fixed 1st April 2005 as the 'Appointed Date' for giving effect to the scheme, and consequently, Shriram Overseas Finance Limited has been dissolved without being wound up." "In the meanwhile, SOFL has obtained permission from the Registrar of Companies, Tamil Nadu to convene and hold its Annual General Meeting on or before December 31, 2006, which otherwise should have been held on or before September 30, 2006. Hence, prior to the pronouncement of the aforesaid Order and as required under the Companies act, 1956, SOFL, by its letter dated November 30, 2006, had sent intimation to the Exchange about its Annual General Meeting to be held on 30th December, 2006 and Book Closure dates for AGM purpose. As the transferor company, i.e. SOFL  is dissolved without being would up as a consequence of the aforesaid Order of the Honorable Court, SOFL will not be able to convene and hold its Annual General Meeting as intimated to the Exchanges. Hence, the intimation sent by SOFL may please treated as withdrawn and cancelled due to the operation of law."

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation
DETAILS: "Though, the Scheme of amalgamation as sanctioned by the Honorable High Court envisages that this Company shall fix a Record Date for determining the shareholders to whom the shares are to be allotted by this Company consequent to the Order, by way of good Corporate Governance Practice, the Company has invited all the shareholders of SOFL to attend the 27th Annual General Meeting of the Company to be held on 30th December, 2006 at Rani Seethai Hall, 603, Anna Salai, Chennai 600 006 at 11.00 A M, and has forwarded its 27th Annual Report to the shareholders of SOFL together with the Notice convening the AGM, though the post merger allotment of company's shares to the Shareholders of SOFL have not yet been made."

Ltd. has informed the Exchange that pursuant to Section 192A of the Companies Act, 1956 read with the Companies (Passing of Resolution by Postal Ballot) Rules, 2001, the Company is seeking consent of members by way of postal ballot for passing the following resolutions through Postal Ballot: Special Resolution under Section 17 of the Companies Act, 1956 for alteration of object clause of Memorandum of Association of the Company. SUBJECT: Conversion of Warrants
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that UNO Investments were allotted 29,66,000 no. of warrants, each convertible into one equity shares of Rs.10/- each by way of preferential allotment on February 16, 2005 at an exercise price of Rs. 35/- per warrant. At the time of allotment, a sum of Rs. 3.50 per warrant was paid by the allottee as the subscription amount for the warrants, which is to be adjusted against the warrant exercise price at the time of exercise of their option for conversion. Similarly UNO Investments were also allotted 27,49,000 warrants by Shriram Investments Ltd. (SIL) by way of preferential allotment on the same terms and conditions as above. Consequent to the amalgamation of SIL with this company as sanctioned by the Hon'ble High Court of Madras vide its order dated November 25, 2005, UNO Investments are also entitled for 27,49,000 warrants of this company in lieu of the 27,49,000 warrants held by them in SIL. Accordingly, in aggregate, they are holding 57,15,000 warrants on which they have exercised their option to convert them into equity share vide their letter dated July 27, 2006. The Company has also received the balance amount of the Rs. 31.50 payable on each of these warrants. At the meeting of the Committee of Board of Directors held on August 07, 2006 as per the terms of issue of the said warrants, the company has converted the said 57,15,000 warrants held by UNO Investments into 57,15,000 equity shares of Rs. 10/- each and allotted these shares to UNO Investments. These shares shall rank pari passu with the existing equity shares of the company.

The Board at the meeting held on November 30, 2005 took on record the merger order copy granted by the Honourable High Court, Madras. As per the Scheme of Amalgamation as approved by the Honourable  High Court, Madras, the whole of the undertaking of SIL comprising of its business, all its assets and liabilities of the transferor Company, i.e. SIL shall be transferred to and vest in this Company as of April 01, 2005, being the appointed day, without any further act or deed. The Directors at the Meeting referred to above have declared an Interim Dividend of 10% on the Equity shares for the year 2005-2006. SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that At the meeting held on September 20, 2005 have, subject to the approval of shareholders, approved; (1) issue of equity shares and Convertible Warrants to Shriram Holdings (Madras) Private Limited , a wholly owned subsidiary of Shriram Financial Services Holdings (P) Ltd. (a) upto 1,27,04,870 equity shares of Rs.10/- each and (b) upto 1,00,00,000 warrants convertible at the option of the holder into Equity shares of Rs.10/-each at the rate of 1 Equity share for every warrant within 18 months from the date of their allotment, for cash on Preferential basis at a price not less than Rs.110.10 per share (including a premium of Rs.100.10 per share) which is the price as determined under SEBI (Disclosure and Investor Protection ) Guidelines on Preferential Issues. (2) Issue of ADRs/GDRs/FCCBs upto a maximum of US$ 60 million subject to applicable laws. The company has further informed that it was decided to convene an EGM on October 17, 2005 to obtain the approval of shareholders with regard to the above.

SUBJECT: Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that as per Section 192A of the Companies Act, 1956, the company is seeking consent of the shareholders by means of a postal ballot for the approval of the resolution of the Directors guaranteeing the repayment of moneys payable in terms of the Deed of Guarantee entered into by the Company. The BODs have appointed Sri V Mahesh, Practicing Company Secretary, as Scrutinizer for conducting the postal ballot process. The results of the postal ballot will be declared by the Chairman of the meeting at the AGM of the shareholders of the Company scheduled on September 09, 2005. A copy of the postal ballot notice shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation/Others
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that : 1. The Board at the meeting held on July 28,2005 has, subject to all requisite approvals and sanctions of the members, creditors and regulatory authorities as may be required, approved the Scheme of Amalgamation of Shriram Investments Ltd with the Company. The Appointed Date has been fixed as April 01, 2005. The Board has recommended the share exchange ratio of 1 (one) Equity Share of Rs. 10 each fully paid up of the Company for every 1 (one) Equity Share of Rs. 10 each fully paid up of Shriram Investments Ltd. The exchange ratio for the number of shares of the company to be issued to the shareholders of Shriram Investments Ltd is based upon the valuation conducted by Ernst and Young Pvt Ltd. 2. The Board also decided to implement Employees Stock Option Scheme subject to the necessary approvals.

SUBJECT: Public Announcement
DETAILS: Enam Financial Consultants Pvt. Ltd. has submitted to the Exchange a copy of the Post Offer Public Announcement dated June 24, 2005, regarding the Open Offer by Uno Investments ("Acquirer/Uno") and ChrysCapital III, LLC (The "PAC/ChrysCapital") to the equity shareholders of Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited ("Target or STFCL") to acquire 1,30,85,710 Equity Shares of Rs.10/- each, representing 20% of the outstanding voting equity share capital of STFCL, at a price of Rs.35/- per fully paid-up Equity Share payable in cash (the "Offer" or "Open Offer"). The details of the same are as follows:- 1) Date of the opening of the offer - May 17, 2005; 2) Date of the closure of the offer - June 06, 2005; 3) Offer price - Rs.35/-; 4) Shares acquired in the Offer - 180,429 shares i.e. 0.28%; 5) Post offer share holding of the Acquirer & the PAC - 1,36,59,429 shares i.e. 20.88%; 6) Post offer share holding of Public - 4,41,22,992 shares i.e. 67.44%. A copy of the Post Offer Public Announcement shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Dividend/Book Closure/Date of AGM
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the board of directors at their meeting held on June 28, 2005 recommended final equity dividend @ 15%. The company has further informed that the Register of members and share transfer books will remain closed from September 01, 2005 to September 09, 2005 (both days inclusive) for the purpose of AGM and for determining the members eligible for dividend.

SUBJECT: Corrigendum to Open offer
DETAILS: Enam Financial Consultants Pvt. Ltd., Managers to the Offer have informed the Exchange of the Corrigendum Public Announcement regarding the Open Offer by Uno Investments ("Acquirer/Uno") and ChrysCapital III, LLC (The "PAC/ChrysCapital") to the equity shareholders of Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited ("Target or STFCL") to acquire 1,30,85,710 Equity Shares of Rs.10/- each, representing 20% of the outstanding voting equity share capital of STFCL, at a price of Rs.35/- per fully paid-up Equity Share payable in cash (the "Offer" or "Open Offer"). The Revised Schedule for the Offer is as follows: i) Specified date (for the purpose of determining the names of shareholders to whom the Letter of Offer would be sent): March 04, 2005; ii) Date of opening of the Offer: May 17, 2005; iii) Date of closing of the Offer: June 06, 2005. The details of the public announcement as a Corrigendum to the company's earlier public announcement shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Proceedings of EGM
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has submitted to the Exchange a copy of the proceedings of the EGM of the company held on February 3, 2005 and that of the Chairman's speech delivered thereat. The details of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Limited Review Report
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the auditors have conducted the limited review for the un-audited financial results for the quarter December 31, 2004 and found the same to be in order subject to certain observations. The observations are: As informed to the auditors, impact of Accounting Standard 28 on Impairment of Assets will be considered by the management on half yearly basis, effect of which, if any, on the quarterly profits is not ascertained.

SUBJECT: Disc under Reg Subs Acq &Takeover & SEBI Insider Trading Reg
DETAILS: Uno Investments have informed the Exchange that they have acquired 13479000 equity shares aggregating to 20.60% of the total paid up capital of Shriram Transport Finance Limited on February 16, 2005. The mode of acquisition is through preferential allotment and the shareholding of Uno Investments after the said acquisition is 13479000 shares aggregating to 20.60% of the total paid up capital of Shriram Transport Finance Limited.

SUBJECT: Open Offer
DETAILS: Enam Financial Consultants Pvt. Ltd. ("Manager to the Offer"), has informed the Exchange that Uno Investments (hereinafter referred to as the "Acquirer") and ChrysCapital III, LLC (the Person acting in concert/PAC) are making an offer to the shareholders (other than Acquirer, PAC and Promoters of Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. [STFCL] who are parties to the Investment Agreement) of STFCL to acquire 1,30,85,710 fully paid-up Equity Shares of Rs.10/- each of STFCL ("Equity Shares"), representing 20% of the outstanding voting equity share capital (post Preferential Issue) of STFCL, at a price of Rs.35 per fully paid-up Equity Share (the "Offer Price") payable in cash in terms of regulation 20 and 21 of the Regulations (the "Offer" or "Open Offer"). The Offer is not conditional on any minimum level of acceptance. The Schedule to the offer is as follows: (1) Specified Date (for the purpose of determining the names of shareholders to whom the Letter of Offer would be sent) - March 04, 2005. (2) Date of Opening of the Offer - April 18, 2005. (3) Date of Closing of the Offer - May 07, 2005. The details of the public announcement shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Reg.7(3) of SEBI (Substantial Acq of shares &Takeovers),1997
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that Shriram Financial Services Holdings (P) Limited (formerly known as Shriram Chits and Investment Pvt.Ltd.) have acquired 631640 shares aggregating to 1.22% of the total paid-up capital of Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited on February 10,2005.The mode of acquisition is through off market and the shareholding of  Shriram Financial Services Holdings (P) Limited after the said acquisition is 7319773 shares aggregating to 14.09% of the total paid-up capital of Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited.

DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. The mode of acquisition is through preferential allotment and the shareholding of Uno Investments after the said acquisition is 13479000 shares aggregating to 20.60% of the total paid up capital of the company.

SUBJECT: Issue of equity shares and/or warrants
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the BOD's at their meeting held on February 16, 2005, have allotted to Uno Investments, a wholly owned subsidiary of ChrysCapital III, LLC : a) 1,34,79,000 Equity Shares of Rs.10/- each for cash at Rs.35/- per share (including a premium of Rs.25/- per share) fully paid up on preferential basis; b) 29,66,000 Warrants, convertible into Equity Shares at a later date, of Rs.10 each for cash at Rs.35/- per share (including a premium of Rs.25/- per share) on which an amount equivalent to ten percent of the issue price has been paid up.  At the said meeting the Board has also given its inprinciple approval for proposals relating to restructuring / reorganization (including merger / demerger / amalgamation) of the Company with Shriram Investments Limited and / or Shriram Overseas Finance Limited.

SUBJECT: Disc under SEBI(Subs Acqui. of shares &takeovers) Reg 1997
DETAILS: Shriram Financial Services Holdings (P) Limited (formerly known as Shriram Chits and Investment Pvt.Ltd.) has informed the exchange that they have acquired 631640 shares aggregating to 1.22% of the total paid-up capital of Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited on February 10,2005.The mode of acquisition is through off market and the shareholding of  Shriram Financial Services Holdings (P) Limited after the said acquisition is 7319773 shares aggregating to 14.09 of the total paid-up capital of Shriram Transport Finance Company Limited.

SUBJECT: Notice of EGM
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that an EGM of the company will be held on February 03,2005.The details of the notice of the EGM shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Issue of shares on preferential basis
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the BOD's of the Company at their meeting held on January 05, 2005, subject to the approval of shareholders, approved issue to Uno Investments, a wholly owned subsidiary of ChrysCapital III, LLC  (a) upto 1,34,79,000 Equity shares of Rs.10 each, and (b) upto 29,66,000 warrants convertible at the option of the holder into Equity Shares of Rs.10 each at the rate of 1 Equity Share for every warrant within 18 months from the date of their allotment,  for cash on Preferential basis at Rs.35/- per share including a premium of Rs.25/- per share.

SUBJECT: Interim Dividend/Record Date
DETAILS: Shriram Transport Finance Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the BODs of the company at their meeting held on November 30, 2004 have declared an Interim Dividend of 10% on the equity shares for the year 2004-2005.The Board has fixed December 16, 2004 as the record date for determining the shareholders entitled to receive the said dividend.
